slides.title: Learning to Drive

content.subtitle: A Step-by-Step Guide for New Drivers

slides.notes: Welcome to your journey toward becoming a safe, confident driver. Driving is a skill that takes practice, patience, and responsibility. Let's build a strong foundation together.

slides.title: Before You Start

callouts.heading: Seatbelt First
callouts.text: Always buckle up before starting the engine. It's the law and your best protection.

callouts.heading: Adjust Everything
callouts.text: Set mirrors, seat, and steering wheel before driving, never while moving.

callouts.heading: Check Requirements
callouts.text: Ensure you have a valid learner's permit and a licensed adult supervisor.

slides.notes: Safety starts before you even turn the key. These habits should become automatic every single time you get behind the wheel, whether you're driving across town or across the country.

slides.title: Pre-Drive Checklist
slides.notes: Go through this checklist every time until it becomes second nature. Taking 30 seconds before driving can prevent accidents and ensure a comfortable, safe trip.

slides.title: Vehicle Controls

left: Gear selector: P R N D

slides.notes: Spend time in a parked car familiarizing yourself with every control. Know where everything is so you never have to search while driving.

slides.title: Starting the Car
slides.notes: Modern cars won't start unless the brake is pressed. This safety feature prevents accidental rolling. Always check your mirrors one more time before releasing the brake.

slides.title: Basic Maneuvers
slides.notes: Smooth inputs are the hallmark of a skilled driver. Jerky movements startle passengers and can cause loss of control. Practice in empty parking lots until movements feel natural.

slides.title: Speed Zones
slides.notes: Speed limits exist for a reason. In neighborhoods, low speeds give you time to react to the unexpected. On highways, matching traffic speed is actually safer than going too slow.

slides.title: Essential Road Rules
slides.notes: Traffic rules aren't suggestions. Running a red light or rolling through a stop sign can result in tickets, accidents, or worse. Develop perfect habits from the start.

slides.title: Safety First

callouts.heading: No Distractions
callouts.text: Never text, eat, or reach for objects while driving. It can wait.

callouts.heading: 3-Second Rule
callouts.text: Maintain at least 3 seconds of following distance from the car ahead.

callouts.heading: Practice Makes Perfect
callouts.text: Every hour of supervised practice builds your skills and confidence.

slides.notes: Distracted driving kills thousands every year. Your phone notification is never more important than your life or the lives of others on the road.

slides.title: Practice Plan
slides.notes: Gradual progression builds competence without overwhelming you. Don't rush to highways or night driving until you're confident in basic situations. Every driver develops at their own pace.
